dmca.title: [Fwd: Re: [Fwd: [ABUSE] Is this web site hosted by your service?]]
dmca.body:
nc 

-----Original Message-----
From: The Planet Policy Enforcement [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] 
Sent: Friday, June 24, 2005 4:34 PM
To: copyright@theplanet.com
Subject: [Fwd: Re: [Fwd: [ABUSE] Is this web site hosted by your service?]]

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

Forwarding to Copyright for review.

- -------- Original Message --------
Subject: Re: [Fwd: [ABUSE] Is this web site hosted by your service?]
Date: Thu, 23 Jun 2005 22:02:40 -0400 (EDT)
From: DogPlay Webmaster <feedback@dogplay.com>
Reply-To: feedback@dogplay.com
To: The Planet Policy Enforcement <abuse@theplanet.com>
CC: copyright@theplanet.com
References: <42B99BBE.4020300@theplanet.com>

It appears the site has been removed.  Thank you.

Diane Blackman, Webmaster
http://dogplay.com



On Wed, June 22, 2005 1:11 pm, The Planet Policy Enforcement said:
> Your email is being forwarded on to our Copyright counsel for review, 
> at the address of copyright@theplanet.com.
> 
> -------- Original Message --------
> Subject: [ABUSE] Is this web site hosted by your service?
> Date: Sat, 18 Jun 2005 23:57:24 -0400 (EDT)
> From: Diane Blackman <diane@dogplay.com>
> Reply-To: diane@dogplay.com
> To: abuse@theplanet.com
> 
> I am researching a situation where someone copied my web site without 
> permission. The site that stole my web site is PETSDOG.INFO In my 
> research I believe that I found that your business The Planet is the 
> host of the site.
> 
> The address xhlofzxhl@hotpop.com is on the domain registration for the 
> site that took my work without permission.
> 
> That same address was on another domain registration that did the same 
> thing to another webmaster.  That site has been pulled but was 
> FOODALL.INFO
> http://forums.digitalpoint.com/showthread.php?t=9686
> 
> There are links to foodall.info contained in the source code of the 
> home page of the site that copied my material.
> 
> Is this website http://www.petsdog.info a legitimate customer of your 
> business?
> 
> If you are indeed the host of the site then you would be the correct 
> entity to receive a DMCA notice?
> 
> Diane Blackman
> http://dogplay.com
> diane@dogplay.com
> 
> 
> 
> 

- --
Thanks,
Policy Enforcement
The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
http://www.theplanet.com/aup/
-----BEGIN PGP SIGNATURE-----
Version: GnuPG v1.2.5 (MingW32)
Comment: Using GnuPG with Thunderbird - http://enigmail.mozdev.org

iD8DBQFCvHwuvK/XpJs6oyURAq6tAKCZ3+mgtwG2gMR3/uTYnLjMjVuCvwCeLdl/
OTqn/LSBMOrrYXQKzbagFMM=
=dQ34
-----END PGP SIGNATURE-----
